Describe the app you want to build. The more detail, the better. Or create from blank Generating the content. This may take few minutes... Add screen Create screen with AI Proceed to generate screens Create project Do you want to create the project? Some screens are still being generated. Discard result Open AI assistant Failed to generate screen. Please try again later. Failed to generate the response. Please try again later. Failed to generate the response. Maximum timeout reached. Please try again later. Interrupted by the user Describe your app's purpose or features Try these suggestions: A social media app with user profiles, posts, and comments A task management app with categories, due dates, and priorities An e-commerce app with product catalog, shopping cart, and checkout A weather app with current conditions and forecast A fitness tracking app with workouts and progress charts A note-taking app with folders and rich text editing A recipe app with ingredients, instructions, and ratings A chat messaging app with groups and media sharing You need to login in order to process the request Describe what kind of screen you want to build You need to sign in to use AI-assisted project creation You need to sign in to configure Firebase settings Add action Add a Action icon Add app state Add API Add string after Add string before Add header Add a new chip Add conditional action Add data type Add data type from JSON Add enum Add enum entry Add else if block Add field Add field to update Add filter Add image asset Add new component Add new modifier Add query parameter Add parameter Add screen Add new screen Add a new tab Add value Add state to set Advanced settings Align Horizontal Center Align Horizontal End Align Horizontal Start Alignment Top Alignment Center Alignment Alignment Bottom Alignment Top Start Alignment Top Start Alignment Top End Alignment Center Start Alignment Center Alignment Center End Alignment Bottom Start Alignment Bottom Center Alignment Bottom End Whether the field can be left blank. (Spaces, tabs, and newlines are considered blank) Already included Api call 1. Fill in the API name and the valid URL.
(Optionally, adjust the header or query parameters) 2. Click the "Test API" button to test the API. 3. Select the element you want to expose as the result of the API in the right pane. 4. Click "Save" button. Then you can bind the result of the API in the UI builder. App state App states App states are values retained on your local device, functioning similarly to global states.
 They can be referenced from any screen. Apply change Toggle if the screen appears as part of the Navigation Arrangement Horizontal Center Arrangement Horizontal End Arrangement Horizontal Start Back to Screen Bind dynamic items Bottom sheet Show borders Hide borders Bring to front Call API Condition must not be empty Conditional property for ComposeFlow main logo Component A component is a reusable set of composables.
 Once defined, you can reuse it in multiple places with the same definition. Component parameters Component states Contains Cancel You can't delete a component used in the project Change font family Change to day theme Change to night theme Check for update Clear value Component name Connect Connect with Firebase to proceed Connect with Firebase to proceed
 Go to Settings -> Firebase to connect Confirm Confirmation Configure icon Conditional property Copy Copy code Copy screen Modify name Copied code Convert to Component Create user with"> Create Creating app... Custom Dark scheme Data type Data type name Define the nature of your data, such as text, numbers, or boolean values.
 Use custom data types to structure your data effectively, ensuring it meets your specific application needs. Default value Define the action Delete Are you sure you want to delete the API? Delete chip Delete color Delete app state Delete data type Delete data field Delete enum Delete enum value Delete icon Delete instant Delete property Delete project? Delete the project Delete screen Delete transformation Delete the tab Dialog, bottom sheet, drawer Double click Downloading JDK ... You need to download the JDK to run the preview. Do you want to download? Valid java installation isn't found. Try again later Dynamic items Dynamic items can be assigned to a LazyList (such as LazyColumn or LazyRow)
 to generate a dynamic number of items. States with a List type can be assigned as dynamic items. Dynamic items can be assigned only a single direct child of a LazyList Edit Edit actions with the editor Edit app state Edit data field Edit Firebase project Id Edit component Edit value Edit modifiers in the editor. Reordering modifiers is only allowed within the editor Empty actions Email and password Ends with Enabled Enable Authentication on Firebase You need to integrate wth Firebase Authentication.
 Go to settings -> Firebase and enable it. Enable Firestore on Firebase You need to integrate wth Firebase Firestore.
 Go to settings -> Firebase and enable it. Enum An enum lets you create a list of named values that you can use throughout your code Equals Failed to download the JDK. Try again later. Failed to load the project Field name Field type Filter Add AND operator Add OR operator Add single filter Replace with AND operator Replace with OR operator Finished downloadidng JDK Enable Firebase Authentication and add authentication provider(s) if you want to integrate it with ComposeFlow. Make sure to enable Firestore and the database is created You can use Firebase features such as Firebase Auth and Firestore by connecting your project to Firebase. Save to Firestore Cloud Firestore is a scalable NoSQL database built on Firebase infrastructure.
 By associating a Firestore collection with a data type, you can easily update or query entities directly from your app. Same collection name is already associated Associate a data type By associating a data type with a Firestore collection, the documents in the collection are recognized as a list of entities of that data type To associate with an existing collection, the name must exactly match the name in the Firebase console Delete Firestore collection to Data type relationship? Delete document Update document Font family Font size Font weight Format as Compact device: width < 600 Medium device: 600 <= width < 840 Expanded device: 840 < width Function parameters Greater than Greater than or equal to Horizontal arrangement Horizontal Space Around Arrangement Horizontal Space Between Arrangement Horizontal Space Evenly Arrangement Icon in Navigation Index Index at information Configures the initial screen depending on if the user has logged in or not. The initial screen appears when the user is not logged in. This screen can't be part of the navigation Invalid Invalid action(s) exists Invalid input Invalid output Invalid usage: this modifier must be inside a specific parent composable. Invalid reference Invalid asset reference Invalid API reference Invalid API parameter reference Invalid %1$s resource reference Invalid screen reference Navigation Drawer is not set Invalid type Is List Image assets Project specific images Image from asset Image from network Initialize Insert value at index Is empty %s is not assignable to %s Path to java directory. Used to run the project to preview the app.
 This is normally automatically set from the ComposeFlow app and can't be edited in the settings. Label in Navigation Determines how many items are generated in the LazyList.
 If items are generated by binding a data source, the number of items are determined by the data source. Length Less than Less than or equal to Letter spacing Light scheme Loading failed image Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Log out Map Mod equals to Multiplied by Must be longer than min Navigate back Navigate to New project No data types are defined. No issues are found! Keep up the great work! Please check and fix them. Profile image Project load failed Redo Remove Remove asset Remove component Remove else if block Remove filter Remove first value Remove last value Remove header Remove the modifier Remove navigation Remove parameter Remove succeeded Remove TopAppBar Remove value at index Reset Reset fonts Reset fonts to defaults Reset to default colors Screen name Screen parameters Screen states Screens Seed color Main color used to generate a full color palette for an app's UI Select all Select color Select data source Select icon Select fields to update Select parent Composable Select parameter Selected type Send to back Show only matching type Show states matching the target type Select Json element Set default values from JSON Set from JSON Set from parameter Set from state Set from state for Select String Resource Use string resource Search string resources... No string resources available Select Set value Set value for field Set state Settings Sign in with Sign in with Google Sign out Use without sign in Get Started Sign in is not available - configure authentication in local.properties Sign in is recommended to enable AI-assisted edits Size Source state is equal to destination state Determines how the top app bar responds to scrolling of the scaffold's inner content.
 You can only see the effect of this property in the generated preview or app
 instead of in the canvas. Show BottomAppBar Show bottom sheet Show nav drawer Component used as the content Show navigation This screen does not have a navigation drawer Show Snackbar Show TopAppBar Show on Navigation Sorted Sorted by Source color Split State name Starts with Style name Substring after Substring before Tap to collapse Tap to expand Tap to hide Tap to show Toggle value Theme colors To String Toggle visibility Toggle the visibility of the screen specific TopAppBar.
 (Common TopAppBar is used if the screen is part of the navigation) Toggle the visibility of the BottomAppBar. Transform state Type Update colors Update type Update value at index Updated color schemes Updated fonts Upload file Upload failed Upload succeeded Undo Unselect all Validator The field specifies the type of input it accepts.
For example, if set to Int, only integer values can be assigned to this field. Value Vertical arrangement Vertical Bottom Arrangement Vertical Center Arrangement Vertical Top Arrangement Vertical Space Around Arrangement Vertical Space Between Arrangement Vertical Space Evenly Arrangement Visibility Visible in Specifies on which types of devices this element is visible.
Note that this assumes the expected width for each device type. Define the conditions to identify the entities to update Wrap with Zoom in Zoom out Reset position and zoom
A layout container that positions children relative to its edges. Useful for overlapping elements. A vertical layout container that arranges children in a single column from top to bottom. A horizontal layout container that arranges children in a single row from left to right. Displays static or dynamic text with customizable styling, font, and formatting options. An interactive element that triggers actions when pressed. Supports various styles and states. Displays vector icons using Material Design icons or custom vector graphics. Displays images from assets, network URLs, or other sources with scaling and styling options. An input field for collecting text from users with validation and formatting support. A toggleable input that allows users to select or deselect an option with checked/unchecked states. A toggle control that switches between two states, commonly used for settings and preferences. An input control for selecting numeric values within a specified range using a draggable thumb. A selection control that displays a list of options when activated, allowing single selection. A vertically scrolling list that efficiently renders only visible items, ideal for large datasets. A horizontally scrolling list that efficiently renders only visible items for side-to-side navigation. A vertically scrolling grid layout that efficiently displays items in columns with lazy loading. A horizontally scrolling grid layout that efficiently displays items in rows with lazy loading. A Material Design card container with elevation and rounded corners for grouping related content. A container for organizing multiple chips, allowing single or multiple selection modes. A top navigation bar with title, navigation icon, and action buttons following Material Design. A bottom navigation bar for primary actions and navigation, positioned at screen bottom. A slide-out navigation panel that provides access to app destinations and functionality. An individual item within a navigation drawer for navigating to specific destinations. A floating action button for the primary action on a screen, following Material Design guidelines. A container for organizing content into tabs, allowing users to switch between different views. A horizontal container that displays tab items for navigation between content sections. An individual tab item within a tab row for switching between different content panels. The content area that displays different content based on the selected tab. A swipeable container that allows horizontal navigation between pages of content. A horizontal line element used to visually separate content sections or groups. A vertical line element used to visually separate content sections or groups. An invisible element that adds spacing between components for layout purposes. A complete screen container that serves as the root for all UI elements on a page. A pre-styled button for Google Sign-In integration with proper branding and functionality. A reusable custom component that encapsulates UI elements and logic for multiple uses. Open Source Licenses Close + %1$d Composables selected Select a single Composable to edit properties Focus a single Composable to modify the actions %1$d Composables Ask me anything about your project... Preparing app architecture... Edit brush Delete brush Brush type Brush colors Linear Gradient Radial Gradient Sweep Gradient Add color Brush preview Gradient parameters Tile mode Start X Start Y End X End Y Center X Center Y Radius
Welcome to ComposeFlow! Let's take a quick tour of the visual UI builder that helps you create beautiful Jetpack Compose interfaces.
Component Palette Drag and drop UI components from this palette onto your canvas. You'll find buttons, text fields, images, and more layout components here.
Design Canvas This is your design canvas where you build your UI. You can preview it on different devices and interact with components in real-time.
Property Inspector Select any component on the canvas to edit its properties here. Modify colors, text, sizes, and add modifiers to customize your components.
AI Assistant Use the built-in AI assistant to describe what you want to build. It can create entire screens, modify components, and help with complex layouts using natural language.
Ready to Build! You're all set! Start by dragging a component from the palette or ask the AI assistant to create something for you. Happy building!
